summary: This document is a collection of FAA forms (337, 8110-3, 8110-2) and engineering orders detailing major repairs and alterations performed on the aircraft registered as N188TS, a Raytheon 400A series owned by THORAIR LLC. The work includes an engine inlet rivet repair and the installation of an ADS-B Out system. The records show the involvement of maintenance companies Constant Aviation and Nextant Aerospace, and certification by FAA designees. This is a technical document titled 'Instructions for Continued Airworthiness for the Installation of ADS-B Out on Part 25 Aircraft' (Report No. 584-00-0047, Revision D). It is a proprietary manual from BHE & Associates, Ltd., detailing the installation, inspection, and maintenance procedures for ADS-B Out systems on various private jet models. The document is approved by the FAA via ODA VT-DRB Aviation Consultants. This document is a technical manual titled 'Instructions for Continued Airworthiness' (Report No. 584-00-0047, Rev: D) issued by BHE & Associates, Ltd. It provides detailed maintenance, inspection, and troubleshooting procedures for avionics equipment (GPS/SBAS sensors and transponders) installed on various private jet models, including several associated with Jeffrey Epstein's fleet such as Gulfstream and Bombardier aircraft. The document appears to be part of regulatory compliance or certification paperwork. This document consists of FAA forms and correspondence related to the maintenance, repair, and airworthiness certification of two aircraft: N493LX and N188TS. It includes a Major Repair and Alteration form (FAA Form 337) for N188TS, owned by THORAIR LLC, detailing the installation of winglets. It also contains airworthiness certificates and a letter noting a clerical discrepancy for N188TS. This document contains FAA forms and records related to the modification and certification of a Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A (serial RK-244), registered as N493LX and later N188TS. It includes a Supplemental Type Certificate (STC) for engine replacement, a major repair and alteration form (FAA Form 337), and applications for airworthiness certificates, showing the aircraft's transition between owners Flight Options LLC and ThorAir LLC. This document is a collection of FAA forms and correspondence related to the airworthiness certification and registration of aircraft N493LX (serial RK-244, a Beechjet 400A/Nextant 400XT). It includes standard and special airworthiness certificates, applications, authorizations, and a major repair/alteration form, showing the aircraft's ownership transition between Flight Options LLC and ThorAir LLC, and its operation by ThorSport Inc. This document is an FAA Form 337 detailing the installation of avionics equipment on the aircraft with registration N493LX. It lists specific parts, weights, and arm measurements, and is dated May 30, 2013. It appears to be a technical record related to the modification of an aircraft. This document is a collection of FAA forms, Supplemental Type Certificates (STCs), and related technical records detailing major repairs, alterations, and certifications performed on a Raytheon/Beechcraft 400A aircraft, registration N493LX, owned by Flight Options LLC. The work was performed and certified by Nextant Aerospace LLC and involves engine replacement, avionics upgrades, and interior refurbishments. This document consists of FAA Form 337 (Major Repair and Alteration) and Form 8110-3 (Statement of Compliance) records for aircraft N493LX (serial RK-244), a Raytheon/Beechcraft 400A owned by Flight Options LLC. The forms detail several modifications performed by Nextant Aerospace in late 2012 and 2013, including structural alterations to the baggage area, installation of new pitot probes, and cockpit provisions, all certified by an FAA Designated Engineering Representative. This document is a collection of FAA Form 337 and Form 8110-3 records detailing major repairs and alterations performed on a Hawker Beechcraft 400A aircraft, registration N493LX, serial number RK-244. The work was performed by Nextant Aerospace for the owner, Flight Options LLC, between 2012 and 2013, covering modifications to electrical systems, structures, and avionics. This is a Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Statement of Compliance with Airworthiness Standards for a Hawker Beechcraft 400A aircraft (S/N RK-244). The document approves engineering data to support a repair procedure for the horizontal stabilizer, submitted by Nextant Aerospace. This document is an FAA Form 337 (Major Repair and Alteration) for aircraft N493LX, a Beechjet 400A (serial RK-244), owned by Flight Options, LLC. It details an interior refurbishment and modification, including the installation of a 3-place divan, performed by Constant Aviation in December 2013. The form is supported by engineering compliance statements and a structural analysis report from Lee Products Engineering Services, Inc., certifying the work meets FAA regulations. This document is a collection of FAA Form 8110-3 Statements of Compliance and related maintenance instructions for a Beechjet 400A aircraft (S/N RK-244). It details approvals for structural modifications and interior cabin configurations, specifically a 3-place divan assembly, to meet airworthiness standards. The documents are associated with a Supplemental Type Certificate (STC) and involve the company Constant Aviation and Aviation Fabricators Inc. This is a technical installation and maintenance manual (ICA Document No. AF-528) for a three-place divan (couch) assembly with a restraint system, likely for installation in an aircraft cabin. It details inspection requirements, dimensions, placards, and service instructions. The document is from Aviation Fabricators Inc. in Clinton, MO, and is relevant to the Epstein case as it likely pertains to modifications made to one of his private aircraft. This document is a collection of FAA forms related to the airworthiness certification and operating limitations for a Raytheon Model 400A aircraft, registration N493LX, serial number RK-244. It includes a Statement of Compliance, an Application for Airworthiness Certificate, and a Special Airworthiness Certificate with detailed operating limitations issued for 'Research and Development' purposes. The aircraft is owned by Flight Options LLC and the limitations restrict its use to essential personnel only, prohibiting carrying persons or property for compensation or hire. This document set contains FAA forms, letters, and certificates related to the re-certification of a Beechjet 400A (serial RK-244, registration N493LX) from a standard to an experimental airworthiness certificate for research and development purposes. The aircraft is owned by Flight Options LLC and Nextant Aerospace, LLC is authorized as an agent. The documents detail the program purpose, operating limitations, and authorizations. This document is an FAA Form 337 detailing a major repair and alteration to the Beech Jet 400A aircraft with registration N493LX, owned by Flight Options LLC. It includes a program letter and a special airworthiness certificate for research and development flight testing, authorizing the aircraft for specific experimental purposes. This document is a collection of FAA forms, supplemental type certificates (STCs), and engineering orders related to the modification and maintenance of aircraft N493LX, a Raytheon (Hawker Beechcraft) 400A. It details the installation of new avionics systems, engine replacements, and certification compliance. The aircraft is registered to Flight Options LLC. This document is a collection of FAA Form 337 Major Repair and Alteration records, engineering orders, work compliance instructions, and an airworthiness certificate for a Beechjet 400A aircraft (serial RK-244, registration N493LX/N793TA). It details various installations, repairs, and modifications performed on the aircraft between 2003 and 2011, primarily under the auspices of Flight Options LLC. The records show the aircraft was owned by several entities, including Air Ghislaine Inc. This document appears to be a flight log or maintenance record for an aircraft (MSN 400A) associated with an STC (Supplemental Type Certificate) ST00881WI-D, requesting a record of additional aircraft performed using this STC. It is part of the Epstein-related document set, suggesting it may relate to aircraft used by Epstein or his associates. This document is a collection of FAA Form 337 records detailing major repairs and alterations performed on a Raytheon/Beechcraft Model 400A aircraft, serial number RK-244, registered as N793TA and previously as N428HR. The work includes interior refurbishment, installation of communication and safety systems, and other modifications, with certifications by various aviation mechanics and repair stations. The aircraft is linked to multiple owners, including REI AIR LLC and AIRCAP LLC.

events.title: Engine Inlet Rivet Repair Completion
events.description: A major repair was completed on aircraft N188TS, involving the installation of blind rivets on the right-hand engine inlet forebody assembly.

events.title: ADS-B Out System Installation
events.description: Installation of an Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast Out system on the aircraft was completed, in compliance with an STC (Supplemental Type Certificate).

events.title: Engineering Order Issued
events.description: Nextant Aerospace issued engineering order NT-EO-1118-31 Rev. IR for the engine inlet rivet repair procedure.

events.title: FAA Compliance Approval
events.description: The FAA (via a Designated Engineering Representative) approved the engineering data for the engine inlet rivet repair, confirming compliance with airworthiness standards.

events.title: ADS-B STC Issuance
events.description: The FAA issued Supplemental Type Certificate ST11216DS to BHE & Associates, Ltd. for the installation of ADS-B Out systems on Part 25 aircraft.

events.title: Document Revision/Approval
events.description: The document 'Instructions for Continued Airworthiness' (Report No. 584-00-0047, Rev: D) bears this date on its pages, indicating it was finalized, reviewed, or approved.

events.title: Pitot Probe Installation on N493LX
events.description: Installation of new pitot probes on aircraft N493LX in accordance with STC ST10959SC, as recorded on an amended FAA Form 337.

events.title: Airworthiness Certificate Issuance for N188TS
events.description: Standard Airworthiness Certificate issued for aircraft N188TS (Raytheon 400A, serial RK-244).

events.title: Winglet Installation on N188TS
events.description: Major alteration performed on aircraft N188TS, owned by THORAIR LLC, involving the installation of Nextant Aerospace winglets under STC# ST02371LA.

events.title: Discrepancy Review for N188TS Certificate
events.description: FAA Aircraft Registration Branch (AFS-750) correspondence noting a clerical discrepancy where an airworthiness certificate for N188TS lacked the nationality letter 'N', which was corrected after inspecting the original document.

events.title: STC for Engine Replacement Approved
events.description: The Supplemental Type Certificate (STC) ST02371LA for replacing Pratt & Whitney JT15D-5 engines with Williams International FJ44-3AP engines on the Beechcraft 400A was approved.

events.title: Engine Installation by Nextant
events.description: Nextant Aerospace completed the STC installation, removing the old engines and installing new Williams International engines on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Application for New Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: An application (FAA Form 8130-6) was submitted for a new standard airworthiness certificate for aircraft N493LX (serial RK-244), following modifications and a pending registration change.

events.title: Request for Certificate Due to Registration Change
events.description: ThorAir LLC requested a new airworthiness certificate from the Cleveland Flight Standards District Office because a new registration number (N188TS) was being placed on the aircraft, replacing N493LX.

events.title: Major Repair and Alteration Form Signed
events.description: A revised FAA Form 337 was signed to correct the serial numbers of the engines installed by Nextant Aerospace in 2013, officially approving the return to service.

events.title: Standard Airworthiness Certificate Issuance
events.description: FAA issued a Standard Airworthiness Certificate for aircraft N493LX (RK-244).

events.title: Special Airworthiness Certificate Issuance (Experimental)
events.description: FAA issued a Special Airworthiness Certificate in the Experimental category for research/development for aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Previous Standard Airworthiness Certificate Issuance
events.description: FAA issued a prior Standard Airworthiness Certificate for aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Previous Special Airworthiness Certificate Expiry
events.description: A prior Special Airworthiness Certificate in the Experimental category for aircraft N493LX expired.

events.title: ThorAir Agent Authorization
events.description: ThorAir, LLC authorized Nextant Aerospace, LLC as its agent for FAA actions regarding aircraft N493LX, noting the aircraft is owned by ThorAir and operated by ThorSport, Inc.

events.title: Flight Options Agent Authorization
events.description: Flight Options, LLC authorized Nextant Aerospace, LLC as its agent for FAA actions regarding aircraft N493LX for both experimental and standard airworthiness classifications.

events.title: Major Repair and Alteration
events.description: A major alteration was performed on aircraft N493LX, involving the removal of avionics equipment and installation of an extended range fuel system, approved by Nextant Aerospace.

events.title: Aircraft Avionics Installation
events.description: Installation of multiple avionics components including cursor control panels, data concentrator units, adaptive flight displays, GPS receivers, and power supplies on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Engine Replacement Certification
events.description: Certification for the removal of Pratt & Whitney JT15D-5 engines and installation of Williams International FJ44-3AP engines with Full FADEC on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: In-Flight Entertainment System Installation
events.description: Installation of an In-Flight Entertainment System, Iridium Sat Comm, broadband internet, and cabin lighting systems on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Interior Refurbishment Completion
events.description: Completion of a major interior refurbishment and modification, including seat reupholstering and installation of a 3-place divan on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Approval of Mount Provisions for J9107
events.description: FAA Designated Engineering Representative DERT-410115-CE signed Form 8110-3, approving engineering data (EO 115-12 Rev. C) for adding mount provisions for a component (J9107) in the cockpit sidewall of aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Approval of Upper Aft Baggage Panel Modification
events.description: FAA Designated Engineering Representative DERT-410115-CE signed Form 8110-3, approving engineering data (EO 029 Rev. E) for a structural modification to the upper aft baggage panel of aircraft N493LX to accommodate an engine FADEC wire harness.

events.title: Multiple Aircraft Alterations Completed
events.description: Several major alterations were completed and certified on aircraft N493LX, including the upper aft baggage panel mod, installation of new pitot probes, cockpit mount provisions, and re-installation of ice detector system components. The work was performed by Nextant Aerospace and approved for return to service.

events.title: Approval of Ice Detector Modification
events.description: FAA Designated Engineering Representative Daniel Buzz (DERT-230019-CE) approves engineering data (EO 0130 Rev D) for an ice detector modification on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Approval of Antenna Repair Patch
events.description: An FAA DER (DERT-410115-CE) approves engineering data (EO 139-12 Rev C) for an antenna repair patch on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Approval of Windshield Sealing Deviation and Rib Repair
events.description: An FAA DER (DERT-410115-CE) approves engineering data for a windshield sealing process deviation (EO 1257 Rev A) and a horizontal stabilizer rib replacement kit (NXR-128-6200 Rev B) on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Approval of Pedestal Cover and Gauge Replacement
events.description: An FAA DER (DERT-410115-CE) approves engineering data for a pedestal cover extension modification (EO 1018 Rev F) and the replacement of MD-302 instruments with round standby gauges (EO 1543 Rev D) on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Approval of Clock Deactivation
events.description: An FAA DER (DERT-230019-CE) approves engineering data (EO 1165 Rev B) to deactivate the pilot and co-pilot clocks on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Approval of Windscreen Process and Spoiler Linkage Modifications
events.description: An FAA DER (DERT-410115-CE) approves engineering data for a process deviation for windscreen removal/installation (EO 1303 Rev B) and a spoiler linkage closeout modification (EO 1563 Rev B) on aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Consolidated Work Completion Date
events.description: Multiple FAA Form 337s are signed, indicating the completion and approval for return to service of numerous repairs and alterations performed on aircraft N493LX on this date.

events.title: FAA Approval of Aircraft Repair Data
events.description: The Federal Aviation Administration approved engineering data submitted by Nextant Aerospace to support a repair procedure for the horizontal stabilizer of a Hawker Beechcraft 400A aircraft, serial number RK-244.

events.title: Aircraft Interior Refurbishment and Modification Completion
events.description: Constant Aviation completes a major interior refurbishment and modification on Beechjet 400A, N493LX (serial RK-244), including installation of a 3-place divan and refurbishment of seats and interior panels. The work is certified via FAA Form 337.

events.title: FAA Statement of Compliance Issued
events.description: A Statement of Compliance with Federal Aviation Regulations is issued, certifying that the interior modification data for the Beechjet 400A (RK-244) complies with applicable requirements.

events.title: Structural Analysis Report Released
events.description: Lee Products Engineering Services, Inc. releases Revision IR of its Structural Analysis Report (313-ST-001) for forward galley cabinet modifications on Beechcraft Model 400A aircraft, serials RK-244 and RK-305.

events.title: FAA Approval of Structural Modifications
events.description: Multiple FAA Form 8110-3 Statements of Compliance are issued, approving design data for structural aspects of the Beechjet 400A (S/N RK-244) to support its return to service.

events.title: Functional Test Procedure Release
events.description: Aviation Fabricators issues Revision A of a Functional Test Procedure (Report # AF-475FTP) for STC # ST01572WI, applicable to Hawker Beechcraft 400/400A models.

events.title: Instructions for Continued Airworthiness Release
events.description: Aviation Fabricators issues the initial release (Revision IR) of the Instructions for Continued Airworthiness (Document AF-528) for the modified cabin configuration.

events.title: Manual Revision Date
events.description: The document revision date for the installation and maintenance manual for a three-place divan assembly.

events.title: Flammability Test Report Issued
events.description: Skandia, Inc. issues test report TP 22681 Rev A, documenting flammability oil burner testing for the aircraft.

events.title: Program Letter Dated
events.description: Nextant Aerospace's program letter is dated, outlining the Research and Development flight operations for the aircraft.

events.title: Operating Limitations Issued
events.description: A Designated Airworthiness Representative issues the Special Airworthiness Certificate and Operating Limitations for the aircraft at Cuyahoga Airport.

events.title: Airworthiness Certificate Expiry
events.description: The Special Airworthiness Certificate for the aircraft is set to expire.

events.title: FAA Application for Experimental Certificate
events.description: Application submitted for a U.S. Airworthiness Certificate (Experimental category) for aircraft N493LX (RK-244) for Research and Development purposes.

events.title: Agent Authorization to Nextant Aerospace
events.description: Flight Options LLC authorizes Nextant Aerospace, LLC as its agent for all authorized FAA actions regarding aircraft N493LX (RK-244).

events.title: FAA Issues Special Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: The Federal Aviation Administration issues a Special Airworthiness Certificate (Experimental) for aircraft N493LX (RK-244) for Research and Development, valid until November 16, 2013.

events.title: Original Standard Airworthiness Certificate Issued
events.description: The original Standard Airworthiness Certificate for the Beechjet 400A (N493LX, RK-244) was issued by the FAA.

events.title: Program Letter Submission
events.description: Nextant Aerospace submits a program letter to the FAA Flight Standards District Office in North Olmsted, Ohio, outlining the purpose and plan for using aircraft N493LX for research and development flight testing.

events.title: Special Airworthiness Certificate Issuance
events.description: A Designated Airworthiness Representative (DAR) issues a Special Airworthiness Certificate for aircraft N493LX, superseding its previous standard certificate, authorizing it for Research and Development flight-testing.

events.title: Major Aircraft Alteration Completed
events.description: Nextant Aerospace completes a major avionics upgrade and alteration on aircraft N493LX, removing old equipment and installing new systems including adaptive flight displays, GPS, and a file server unit.

events.title: STC ST10959SC Amendment
events.description: Amendment date for Supplemental Type Certificate ST10959SC related to avionics installation.

events.title: STC ST10959SC Amendment
events.description: Amendment date for Supplemental Type Certificate ST10959SC.

events.title: STC ST10959SC Amendment
events.description: Amendment date for Supplemental Type Certificate ST10959SC.

events.title: STC ST10959SC Amendment
events.description: Amendment date for Supplemental Type Certificate ST10959SC.

events.title: Engine Replacement on N493LX
events.description: Removal of Pratt & Whitney JT15D-5 engines and installation of Williams International FJ44-3AP engines with FADEC on aircraft N493LX, certified by Nextant Aerospace.

events.title: Standard Airworthiness Certificate Issuance
events.description: Original issuance date of the Standard Airworthiness Certificate for aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Engineering Order Issued
events.description: Original date of Engineering Order M25-10/05-011, related to an EFB Mount Assembly installation.

events.title: EFB Mount Removal
events.description: Removal of an EFB Mount Assembly from aircraft N493LX.

events.title: Engineering Order for EFB Mount
events.description: An engineering order was prepared and approved for the installation of an Electronic Flight Bag (EFB) mount assembly on Beechjet 400 aircraft.

events.title: TAWS System Installation
events.description: A Terrain Awareness and Warning System (TAWS) was installed on the aircraft, with FAA field approval based on an existing STC.

events.title: GPWS System Removal
events.description: The existing GPWS system was removed in conjunction with the installation of a new TAWS/EGPWS system.

events.title: TCAS II System Upgrade
events.description: The Collins TCAS II system on the aircraft was upgraded from Change 6.04a to Change 7.0, approved under STC ST00881WI-D.

events.title: Horizontal Stabilizer Fastener Substitution
events.description: Fasteners in the horizontal stabilizer lower skin were substituted per an engineering order.

events.title: Fuselage Skin Repair
events.description: Left fuselage skin above the pylon was repaired in accordance with a technical engineering order.

events.title: Flight Options STC Record Request
events.description: A request is made for a record of any additional aircraft performed using STC ST00881WI-D, with a note that Collins needs to receive data before authorizing additional installations.

events.title: Installation of AlliedSignal Flitefone VI and Sundstrand MK-VI GPWS
events.description: Major alterations performed on aircraft N428HR (RK-244) including installation of an airborne radiotelephone system and a Ground Proximity Warning System at Raytheon Aircraft Services in San Antonio.

events.title: Complete Interior Refurbishment
events.description: Extensive interior refurbishment of aircraft N793TA (RK-244) including recovering seats, headliner, and panels with new materials, performed by Elliott Aviation in Moline, IL.

events.title: Fireblocking of Cabin Seats
events.description: Modification to fireblock all seven cabin seats and the lavatory seat on aircraft N793TA in accordance with FAA regulations, performed by Raytheon Aircraft Services.

events.title: Tail Navigation Light Replacement
events.description: Replacement of the tail navigation light assembly on aircraft N793TA, certified by mechanic Keith Gawsyszawski.

keyFacts: The aircraft with registration N188TS (serial RK-244), a Raytheon 400A, is owned by THORAIR LLC.
Major maintenance work, including an engine inlet rivet repair and ADS-B system installation, was performed in October 2019.
The maintenance and certification involved companies Constant Aviation LLC (repair station CRS# WC7R346J) and Nextant Aerospace LLC.
The documents are standard FAA airworthiness compliance forms, showing no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or any associated individuals.
The aircraft's owner, THORAIR LLC, is an entity previously linked to Jeffrey Epstein's aviation assets.
This is a technical aircraft maintenance manual, not a legal or investigative document related to the Epstein case.
The document is proprietary to BHE & Associates, Ltd., an aviation company based in San Antonio, Texas.
It details the installation of ADS-B Out systems on a wide range of private jet models from manufacturers like Gulfstream, Bombardier, Textron (Citation/Beechjet/Hawker), Dassault, and Learjet.
The manual is FAA approved under Supplemental Type Certificate (STC) No. ST11216DS, with the approval authority listed as ODA VT-DRB Aviation Consultants.

The document's presence in the Epstein case files suggests it may relate to maintenance records for an aircraft associated with the case, but the text itself contains no names, events, or allegations.
This is a highly technical aircraft maintenance manual (Report No. 584-00-0047, Rev: D) for avionics systems, not a legal or investigative document related to criminal activity.
